snippet: It was the first time that Finance Minister Wolfgang Schäuble had mentioned resignation in the debate over Greece’s debt. He has taken a harder line toward Greece than Chancellor Angela Merkel.
abstract: German Finance Min Wolfgang Schauble, who has been criticized for his harsh handling of Greece's financial crisis, says in interview that he would rather resign than go against his convictions; Schauble has differed from Chancellor Angela Merkel's comparatively softer approach to situation; comments come day after German lawmakers vote to open negotiations for third bailout for Greece.
lead_paragraph: It was the first time that Finance Minister Wolfgang Schäuble had mentioned resignation in the debate over Greece’s debt. He has taken a harder line toward Greece than Chancellor Angela Merkel.

headline.main: Minister in Germany Discusses Greece Role
